name: microsoft-graph
label: Microsoft Graph API
description: Connect to Office 365 using Microsoft Graph API

fields.title: Access Token Type
options: On behalf of User - Delegate Permission
fields.name: auth_type
fields.description: Select the method using which you will get authentication tokens used to access the security graph APIs. You can choose between On behalf of User – Delegate Permission or Without a User - Application Permission.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Server URL
Without a User - Application Permission.name: resource
Without a User - Application Permission.description: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Client ID
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_id
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Client Secret
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_secret
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see 'https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp'.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Tenant ID
Without a User - Application Permission.name: tenant_id
Without a User - Application Permission.description: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Verify SSL
Without a User - Application Permission.name: verify_ssl
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Server URL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: resource
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Client ID
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: client_id
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Unique API ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Client Secret
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: client_secret
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Unique API Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see 'https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp'.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Tenant ID
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: tenant_id
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Authorization Code
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: code
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: Authorization code that you acquired in the authorization step.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Getting Access Tokens using the Delegate Permissions method section.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Redirect URL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: redirect_url
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. The redirect URL that you specify here must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you have registered in your app registration portal.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Verify SSL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: verify_ssl
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Risky Users List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all risky users from Microsoft Graph API.

operations.title: Get Risky User Details
operations.description: Retrieve details for a specific risky user from Microsoft Graph API based on the user ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Risky User ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the risky user whose details you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the risky user whose details you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: risk_id

operations.title: Get All Security Alerts
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all alerts or specific alerts from Microsoft Graph API based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Vendor
parameters.description: Specify the name of the vendor for the product that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API. For example, Microsoft
parameters.name: vendor
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the vendor for the product that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API.

parameters.title: Provider
parameters.description: Specify the security product that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API. For example, Cloud Application Security.
parameters.name: provider
parameters.tooltip: Specify the security product that provided the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API. For example, Cloud Application Security.

parameters.title: Severity
parameters.description: Select the alert severity, which is set by the vendor or provider based on which you want to retrieve alerts using Microsoft Graph API. You can choose from the following options: Unknown, Low, Medium, High or Informational.
parameters.tooltip: Select the alert severity, which is set by the vendor or provider based on which you want to retrieve alerts using Microsoft Graph API
parameters.name: severity

parameters.title: Search From
parameters.description: Select the DateTime at which the event(s) that served as the trigger(s) to generate the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.tooltip: Select the DateTime at which the event(s) that served as the trigger(s) to generate the alert you want to retrieve using Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: search_from

operations.title: Get Security Alert
operations.description: Retrieves a specific alert from Microsoft Graph API based on the alert ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique Alert ID using which you want to retrieve the specific alert from Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Alert ID using which you want to retrieve the specific alert from Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.name: alert_id

operations.title: Update Security Alert
operations.description: Updates a specific alert using Microsoft Graph API based on the alert ID, vendor name, provider name, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.description: Specify the unique Alert ID using which you want to update the specific alert from Microsoft Graph API. The alert ID is generated by the provider when an alert is created in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Alert ID using which you want to update the specific alert from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: alert_id

parameters.title: Provider
parameters.description: Specify the provider of product or service in Azure that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the provider of product or service in Azure that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.
parameters.name: provider

parameters.title: Vendor
parameters.description: Specify the name of the vendor of the alert that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, Microsoft.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the vendor of the alert that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. For example, Microsoft.
parameters.name: vendor

parameters.title: Assigned To
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the analyst to whom you want to assign the specific alert that you want to update for triage, investigation, or remediation in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the analyst to whom you want to assign the specific alert that you want to update for triage, investigation, or remediation in Azure.
parameters.name: assigned_to

parameters.title: Feedback
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the analyst feedback on the alert that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose from the following options: Unknown, True Positive, False Positive, or Benign Positive.
parameters.tooltip: Select the analyst feedback on the alert that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure.
parameters.name: feedback

parameters.title: Comments
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the analyst comments that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose between Closed in MCAS or Closed in IPS.
parameters.tooltip: Select the analyst comments that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose between Closed in MCAS or Closed in IPS.
parameters.name: comments

parameters.title: Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the status (life cycle status) that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure. You can choose from the following options: Unknown, New Alert, In Progress, or Resolved.
parameters.tooltip: Select the status (life cycle status) that you want to update in the specific alert in Azure.
parameters.name: status

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the JSON array of strings that store user-definable labels that can be applied to the alert that you want to update in Azure. These tags serve as filter conditions, and you can specify multiple tags using comma-based separators.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the JSON array of strings that store user-definable labels that can be applied to the alert that you want to update in Azure. These tags serve as filter conditions, and you can specify multiple tags using comma-based separators.
parameters.name: tags

parameters.title: Provider Version
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the version of the provider or sub-provider, if it exists, that generated the alert that you want to update in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the version of the provider or sub-provider, if it exists, that generated the alert that you want to update in Azure.
parameters.name: providerVersion

parameters.title: Subprovider
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the name of the sub-provider under the aggregating provider in Azure for the alert t that you want to update in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.SmartScreen.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the sub-provider under the aggregating provider in Azure for the alert t that you want to update in Azure. For example, WindowsDefenderATP.SmartScreen.
parameters.name: subProvider

operations.title: Get Groups
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all groups from Microsoft Graph API.

operations.title: Get Users Within A Group
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all users within a specific group from Microsoft Graph API based on the group ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Group ID
parameters.description: Specify an ID of the group whose users you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph. Note: To get the 'Group ID' use the 'Get Groups' operation.
parameters.tooltip: Specify an ID of the group whose users you want to retrieve from Microsoft Graph. Note: To get the 'Group ID' use the 'Get Groups' operation.
parameters.name: group_id

operations.title: Search Message in Users Mailbox
operations.description: Searches for messages based on 'Subject' delivered to the user within the organization using Microsoft Graph API based on the subject and user list you have specified.

parameters.title: Subject
parameters.description: Specify a subject based on which you want to search messages in Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a subject based on which you want to search messages in Azure.
parameters.name: subject

parameters.title: User List
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated list of user IDs based on which you want to search messages in Azure.
parameters.name: user_list
parameters.tooltip: Specify a comma-separated list of user IDs based on which you want to search messages in Azure.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.tooltip: Number of messages you want to retrieve per user in this request. Default page size is 10. Page size should be between 1 to 1000
parameters.description: (Optional) Number of messages you want to retrieve per user in this request. Default page size is 10. Page size should be between 1 to 1000

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Number of messages you want to skip for each user in this request.
parameters.description: (Optional) Number of messages you want to skip for each in this request.

operations.title: Delete Message
operations.description: Deletes a specific message from the specific user's mailbox in Azure based on the user ID and message ID you have specified.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the user based on which you want to delete the specific message from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the user based on which you want to delete the specific message from Azure.
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.title: Message ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the message that you want to delete from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the message that you want to delete from Azure.
parameters.name: message_id

operations.title: Delete Message Bulk
operations.description: Deletes messages from multiple users' mailboxes in Azure based on the comma-separated list of users you have specified.

parameters.title: User List
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated list of users mailboxes, which is a list of JSON objects, i.e., [{'user_id':", 'message_id':"}, ...]based on which you want to delete bulk messages in Azure.
parameters.name: user_list
parameters.tooltip: Specify a comma-separated list of users mailboxes, which is a list of JSON objects, i.e., [{"user_id":"", "message_id":""}, ...] based on which you want to delete bulk messages in Azure.

operations.title: Revoke User Session
operations.description: Invalidates all the refresh tokens issued to applications for a user.

parameters.title: User ID or PrincipalName
parameters.description: Specify the User ID or PrincipalName of the user whose refresh tokens you want to invalidate (revoke) from Microsoft Graph API.
parameters.name: user
parameters.tooltip: Specify the User ID or PrincipalName of the user whose refresh tokens you want to invalidate (revoke) from Microsoft Graph API.

operations.title: Get All Named Locations
operations.description: Retrieves a list of named location from Azure based on display name, sort order, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the display name of the named location to retrieve from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the display name of the named location to retrieve from Azure.

parameters.title: Required Fields
parameters.name: select
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify filters properties (columns) to retrieve only specified fields in response from Azure. You can choose one or more from ID, Display Name, Created Date Time and Modified Date Time
parameters.tooltip: Specify filters properties (columns) to retrieve only specified fields in response from Azure.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: (Optional) Orders results based on specified field. You can choose from ID, Display Name, Created Date Time or Modified Date Time
parameters.tooltip: Orders results based on specified field.

ID.title: Sort Order
ID.name: order
ID.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
ID.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order

Display Name.title: Sort Order
Display Name.name: order
Display Name.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
Display Name.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order

Created Date Time.title: Sort Order
Created Date Time.name: order
Created Date Time.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
Created Date Time.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order

Modified Date Time.title: Sort Order
Modified Date Time.name: order
Modified Date Time.description: (Optional) Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.
Modified Date Time.tooltip: Orders the response Ascending or Descending order on specified field. By default it retrieves in ascending order.

parameters.title: Count
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Select to retrieve the total count of named locations matched in Azure. By default it is set to false.
parameters.tooltip: Select to retrieve the total count of named locations matched in Azure.

parameters.title: Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of named locations to retrieve in this request.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of named locations to retrieve in this request.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of named locations you want to skip in this request.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of named locations you want to skip in this request.

operations.title: Block New IP Ranges
operations.description: Blocks IPv4 and IPv6 address ranges in specified NamedLocation in Azure.

parameters.title: IP Named Location's UUID
parameters.name: namedLocationUuid
parameters.description: Specify the unique Named Location ID for which you want block the IP addresses.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Named Location ID for which you want block the IP addresses.

parameters.title: IPv4 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv4_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09

parameters.title: IPv6 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv6_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in allowable IPv6 format, defined in IETF RFC5962, to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in allowable IPv6 format, defined in IETF RFC5962, to be blocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47

operations.title: Unblock New IP Ranges
operations.description: Unblocks IPv4 and IPv6 address ranges in specified NamedLocation in Azure.

parameters.title: IP Named Location's UUID
parameters.name: namedLocationUuid
parameters.description: Specify the unique Named Location ID from where you want to remove (unblock) the IP address.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the unique Named Location ID from where you want to remove (unblock) the IP address.

parameters.title: IPv4 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv4_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in IPv4 CIDR format (1.2.3.4/32) to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv4 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 10.10.10.10/14, 10.10.10.10/13, 10.10.10.10/09

parameters.title: IPv6 Ranges
parameters.name: ipv6_ips
parameters.description: Specify IP address ranges in allowable IPv6 format, defined in IETF RFC5962, to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP address ranges in allowable IPv6 format, defined in IETF RFC5962, to be unblocked in the specified named location. You can specify multiple IPv6 ranges as comma-separated values. e.g. 2001:db8::/43, 2001:db8::/47

operations.title: Create IP Range Location
operations.description: Create a new IP range named location.

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the display name of the named location to retrieve from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the display name of the named location to retrieve from Azure.

parameters.title: Is Trusted
parameters.name: is_trusted
parameters.description: Define whether the IP Range is trusted.
parameters.tooltip: Define whether the IP Range is trusted.
